message.content:
To create an expression in LibreOffice Calc that copies the contents of a cell and removes all single quotes, you can use the following formula:

```
=TRIM(SUBSTITUTE(A1, """", ""))
```

Replace `A1` with the cell reference from which you want to copy the content. This formula will remove any double quotes (") and leave only the content without single quotes (''). Note that this formula assumes you are working with a text-based cell value. If you're working with numbers, there should be no need for single or double quotes in the first place.

To apply this formula to another cell, simply copy the formula and paste it into the desired cell. The result will be the content from the source cell with all single quotes removed. |end_of_turn|

Please let me know if you have any further questions or need additional assistance!
